short_summary: RFP for the acquisition of mooring bollards for the port of Cap-aux-Meules
description: PWGSC, on behalf of Transport Canada, is issuing this Request for Proposal (RFP) for the acquisition of mooring bollards specific to the port of Cap-aux-Meules as a part of the maintenance program for port facilities, as detailed in Section 7.

full_summary:
### Government Tender Announcement
#### Competitive Bidding Process

**Tender Title:** EE519-230664
**Tender Number:** WS3641725397-Doc3646350673

**Publication Date:** September 15, 2022
**Tender Closing Date:** October 12, 2022, 14:00:00 EST

**Pre-Qualified Trade Agreements:**
• Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)

**Trade Classification:**
• UNSPSC 25111900 - Marine craft systems and subassemblies

**Notice Type:** Request for Proposal (RFP)
**Procurement Method:** Competitive - Open bidding

**Selection Criteria:** Lowest Price

**Deliveries:**
The tender winner is expected to deliver to the following region:
• Quebec (excluding National Capital Region)

**Valuation Period:**
• Expected Contract Start Date: November 10, 2022
• Expected Contract End Date: November 18, 2023

**Contact Information:**
Simon Prest, Presse
[simon.presse@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:simon.presse@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)

### Terms and Requirements
A detailed requirement specification is outlined in Section 7 of the tender document. Bidders are required to meet the specified requirements and follow the outlined evaluation criteria. A non-mandatory Pre-Tender Conference is held on [insert date], [insert time]. Details for the meeting can be obtained by contacting the contracting authority.

### How to Respond
Bidders should review the Presentation and Award Method Section of the announcement carefully. Responses should include a detailed [Proposal Document], along with any other supporting documents. Submissions should be submitted on the Bidder portal on or before the specified deadlines.

**Evaluation and Award Criteria:**
Successful bidders will be selected based on the lowest price bid. Evaluation and award will be completed in accordance with the [CPR Guidelines](https://www.buyandsell.gc.ca/open-government/open-merit-commissioned-guidelines-en.jsp).

**Provincial Government Designated Amount (GD) procurement process:**

The information provided is in accordance with the designated procurement procedure by the contracting authority. Bidders understand and acknowledge that the information is collected for the purpose of this procurement only.
